I think the stock <abbr title="In-Situ Resource Utilization"><abbr title="In-Situ Resource Utilization">ISRU</abbr></abbr> system is missing a critical part: The ventral (in-line) drill. This simple mod fixes that. It adds a ventral drill that in all other ways (Tech tree node, mass, usefulness) is the same as the stock radial drills.

![Ventral_Drill_for_Stock_ISRU-1583308400.](https://spacedock.info/content/HMV_4317/Ventral_Drill_for_Stock_ISRU/Ventral_Drill_for_Stock_ISRU-1583308400.6996522.jpg)

**Jeb Tested. Bill Approved!**

**I did not make the model.** That credit goes to Nertea. It's the same model as the ventral drill from [Karbonite](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/89401-), with a new name and stats so it can work on stock ore without having to install Karbonite. You should be able to install this along with Karbonite but there is no reason to.

**I did not create the stats**. All I did was copy the stats from the stock radial drills (for <abbr title="In-Situ Resource Utilization"><abbr title="In-Situ Resource Utilization">ISRU</abbr></abbr> stuff) and the Karbonite drill (so it mounted and functioned correctly).

So in short, this is not my work. This is a simple retooling of two things to make a new thing.

**DOWNLOAD**

[Spacedock](https://spacedock.info/mod/1328)

**DEPENDENCIES**

[ModuleManager](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/50533-M). You probably have it already. **NOTE: ModuleManager is a new dependency as of 1.9.1**

**INSTALL**

The Zip file has a folder in it named VentralDrill, just put that folder into your GameData folder.

If you need to, also install [Module Manager](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/50533-M) as per their instructions.

You should, on the next start of KSP, see a Ventral Drill in the same tech tree node as the stock radial drill and/or in the <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building"><abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr></abbr> ready to use.

It should work in <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)"><abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr></abbr> as well. I don't use that though so no clue what's wrong if it doesn't.

**LICENSE**

To match the license of Karbonite and the original drill, this part is licensed under a [Creative Commons 4.0 Share-Alike Attribution Non-Commercial license.](https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/4.0/)

**THANKS**

**Nertea** for the drill model

**Roverdude** for Karbonite, and for the stock <abbr title="In-Situ Resource Utilization"><abbr title="In-Situ Resource Utilization">ISRU</abbr></abbr> system.

**Sarbian** for Module Manager and Nyan Cats.

**DONATIONS**

I do not need donations, but if you want to contribute, please donate to SpaceDock:

[![patreonSD.png](http://i.52k.de/spacedock/patreonSD.png)](https://www.patreon.com/user?u=2903335&ty=h)

There were some changes to the part config for the stock drill, so I put them in this drill to keep things the same.

At the same time, I verified this works as intended in KSP 1.6.0

I have (finally) upgraded the Ventral Drill to 1.9.1, and this is a bigger update than normal. I added a requirement for Module Manager (which we probably all have installed anyway) and now the Ventral Drill automatically copies all relevant stats and modules from the stock game. This means not only less work for me (yay! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")) but also more likelihood that future versions of KSP will "just work" with the Ventral Drill.
